kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
Check out [Diagnosing Xperience by Kentico Page Template issues](https://community.kentico.com/blog/diagnosing-xperience-by-kentico-page-template-issues).
My recommendation would be to use [a SQL migration in CI and CD](https://docs.kentico.com/x/ywAcCQ) to update all web pages that need to use a Page Template now but were created before there were any registered.
1. Create a new page and select the Page Template you've registered. 2. Query for the page template configuration\\ ```SQL SELECT WP.WebPageItemTreePath, CD.ContentItemCommonDataVisualBuilderTemplateConfiguration FROM CMS_ContentItemCommonData AS CD INNER JOIN CMS_WebPageItem AS WP ON CD.ContentItemCommonDataContentItemID = WP.WebPageItemContentItemID ``` 3. Write a migration query to update the pages that need to use the same configuration
